feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 7:32AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds and Blowing Snow Over Dalton Highway Summits... East to northeast winds will increase today on Dalton Highway Summits to 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. Blowing snow will reduce visibility at times to less than one mile and drifting snow may make travel difficult. Winds will diminish Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 5:03AM AKDT until October 26 at 5:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Northeast wind 15 to 25 mph along the Inlet with areas of blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches, highest amounts from Soldotna north to Nikiski. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 25 at 3:40AM AKDT until October 26 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * LOCATION...Kipnuk to Togiak. * WAVES AND SURF...Water levels are expected to rise 1 to 3 feet above normal highest tide. * TIMING...In effect from 1 PM Tuesday to 7 AM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 24 at 10:42PM AKDT until October 27 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches possible. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 1500 feet. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through late Wednesday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 2:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Confidence is increasing in the potential for accumulating snow across the northern panhandle late Tuesday night into Wednesday. The best chance for accumulating snow at sea level is over Haines. As the storm system lifts northward Wednesday, expect a changeover to rain for Haines late morning to early afternoon.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:21AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through the weekend while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:20AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Deland is forecast to fall from Major to Moderate Flood Stage by mid week, then continue slowly declining through Moderate Flood stage through the weekend. Interests along the river should expect these major flood impacts to continue, but a

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:17AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood Stage. The river is forecast to continue a slow decline, dropping from Major to Moderate Flood Stage by the weekend. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts,

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:14AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor continues a slow decline, remaining within Moderate Flood Stage. Levels at Astor will continue a very slow recession through this weekend, although northerly winds may prevent further decline in levels temporarily.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 8:38AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE RISK EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of gusty southerly winds, low relative humidities, and a recent stretch of dry weather will lead to an elevated fire risk today, especially during the late afternoon and evening hours. A Wind Advisory is in effect this afternoon through Wednesday morning for the East TN mountains and foothills.

entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS FOR EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...
